main event: Three oval, reddish pink to blue and back objects, each about the size of a basketball, were seen at an altitude of 900 feet, moving in a jerky, bouncing up and down motion in Poulsbo, Washington on 28 June 1955.
interesting points: The observation lasted for one hour, providing a significant amount of time for the witnesses to study the objects.
The jerky, bouncing up and down motion of the objects is unusual and doesn't fit typical aircraft behavior.
The suggestion that the objects might be balloons poses a mundane explanation, but the erratic motion raises doubts.
An attempt was planned to identify the objects through Balloon Flights scheduled for the same date, indicating a methodical investigation process.
Results of the investigation were awaited to definitively identify the objects.
sighted object: three oval, reddish pink to blue and back objects, each the size of a basketball
